file_content.text: Excellent. Now, to Baras's lair. Look out for trouble. That assassin is here somewhere.
You made it. This is heating up, isn't it?
Baras has taken off the sparring gloves. This assassin was the most lethal to date.
Don't leave anything out. I want to know how it went down.
Tell me what happened.
The attack was sudden and vicious.
I'm sorry I wasn't there to protect you.
I should have been there.
As it was, I was in good hands.
So strong that you suffer the indignity of fleeing?
It's cowardly to retreat.
Oh, in no way was this a defeat.
There was no panic, no confusion. To a man, your people stared into the face of death and did not flinch.
Captain Quinn must be commended. He took on the assailant with no mortal concern.
Lieutenant Pierce and the Twi'lek Vette responded without hesitation and coordinated their attacks and counter-maneuvers perfectly.
Your little Twi'lek performed a miraculous escape.
Lieutenant Pierce reacted selflessly. He kept the assailant off-balance and ushered me away.
Captain Quinn drew the assailant's fire with no thought of his own mortality. And he paid a dear price.
I'm making up for a past indiscretion--my commitment to my lord is unassailable now.
You have nothing to be ashamed of. It is forgotten.
Water under the bridge.
Regardless, I am yours, my lord.
This is the spirit the Empire needs.
I won't exonerate you so easily, Captain.
You're still on shaky ground.
I do not blame you, my lord.
You ride your people hard. I can't argue with the results.
Let's move on. What's left to do?
What now, Vowrawn?
Baras's agents are neutralized. You have brought us to the end game, my friend. It's time for us both to go on the offensive.
If Lieutenant Pierce and the Twi'lek Vette had hesitated or done anything differently, we'd all be dead.
You've successfully neutralized Baras's agents. The end game is upon us. We must both go on the offensive.
Tell me what you have in mind.
What's the plan?
Until the threat against you is over, we must be cautious.
But the assassin is at-large.
Waiting for another attack is suicide. The last move here on Corellia will take both of us.
I'm ready to bang down the Dark Council chamber door and face him.
To Korriban, then.
All in good time, my friend. We've just reached the best part.
In a secret lair on this planet, Baras has bound and indentured an ancient Sith spirit.
He feeds off this spirit's power, stealing all her visions of the future. Everything he has built has come from her insights.
If this spirit is to blame for Baras's strength, it must be destroyed.
Then it dies.
No, my friend. She is as old as the Force. She is the dark side itself. We must free her, not kill her.
Why haven't you acted on this before now?
Why have you waited?
You don't think I've tried? It is the true reason I am warring here. Baras's defenses have repelled my every attempt.
We have disintegrated Baras's hold on the Dark Council. Now he will not be named the Voice of the Emperor.
Why does this matter?
Baras cannot be allowed to remain on the Dark Council. And as long as he is empowered by this spirit, he cannot be defeated.
Only you have the power to break into his lair, and only I know the ritual that unlocks the spirit's bonds.
Deliver me to her, and we will strike the ultimate blow and cripple Baras from within!
Then I am one step closer to finally confronting Baras.
It will be done.
We achieve this, and I will walk you into the Dark Council chamber myself.
That's what I want to hear.
Then make yourself ready. We must strike out immediately.
I'm not sure about this, but I'm intrigued.
It's worth a try.
I like you. You're open-minded and spontaneous, like me. It's what makes the game so exhilarating.
Lead the way. And please be sure that assassin isn't waiting. I'll come when you signal.
All quiet here, my lord. Nothing suspicious, and no further attempts on Darth Vowrawn.
Captain Quinn is an excellent officer. I'm in good hands here.
No trouble so far, my lord. Vowrawn's safe.
Lieutenant Pierce is a rare Imperial. I wish I could harness his ferocity.
All is calm here, master. No further attempts on Darth Vowrawn's life. He's been rather--well--forward with me.
No trouble to report here, master. Although Darth Vowrawn has proposed some once or twice...
Just harmless flirtation, my friend.
Try to remember what's at stake here.
This is no time for games.
Jaesa is her own woman. I trust her to follow her heart.
Have your fun.
Glad you're such a good sport. Her loyalty to you is quite clear.
Glad you're both such good sports. Her devotion to you is quite clear.
Glad you enjoy Jaesa's company.
Have your fun.
It's dangerous to flirt with another man's woman.
Stay away from her.
Why so serious? Playfulness keeps me young.
Jaesa's free to do as she pleases.
Why would I care?
She's an innocent thing. Fun to tease.
She's a wicked delight.
No trouble over here. The old Darth is still in one piece. Here he is.
Your Twi'lek is an amusing child. I may get one for myself.
A job well-done with Colonel Senks. He contacted me, reporting to service. I will put him to excellent use here.
I commend your efforts in dealing with Colonel Senks.
Unfortunate that he had to die. But the war rages on.
Someone like that is a liability. No matter what services he provides.
He couldn't be trusted.
What's done is done. Leave the war to me.
Baras loses a valuable asset, but the Empire doesn't miss a beat. Excellent.
I am the Empire's servant.
It is my duty.
My sights are set on larger stakes.
Baras is all I care about.
Yes, this war will go on for quite some time. Baras is the immediate threat.
Tell me we have news of the false Jedi.
What's next?
Baras's false Jedi is still at large. He leads Jedi against Sith who defy Darth Baras's will. My operative, Shadow, is searching for him.
Unfortunately, Shadow is pinned down by enemy artillery. He has our information but had to go radio silent to avoid capture.
I'll get the information directly.
Then I'll go to him.
If he can't report in or return, what are his orders?
What is his protocol?
Does this mean I have to save his hide?
So he needs rescuing.
Shadow can take care of himself. But you must rendezvous with him to get the intel.
Shadow was cut off on the other side of Axial Park, beyond Coronet Zoo. The park is a front-line battlefield, where the heaviest fighting is taking place.
We have a safe house in that sector. Shadow will be waiting there.
I'll carve a path through the fighting and rendezvous with your man.
No problem.
If you're interested, there is also an opportunity to help the war....
So, I have to wade through a battlefield. Good planning.
This is a pain.
Without warning, the Republic changed its artillery targets. It couldn't be planned for.
Is there more I should know?
Anything else?
Well, there is something else you could do for me....
The bombings that blocked Shadow are hampering our ground forces in Axial Park. If you could destroy the enemy artillery banks along the way, it would be most helpful.
Either way, Shadow will tell you all you need to confront Baras's Jedi spy. We'll talk again when the deed is done.
That assassin had me dead to rights. You did not hesitate to defend me.
My friend, I am convinced. What's more, I believe--with my help--you can defeat Darth Baras.
I was hoping you'd say that.
That's more like it.
Then I have a little confession to make.
I'm perfectly capable of taking him on myself.
Not sure I need your help.
There is much about Baras you do not know.
I'm not looking to serve someone new. I answer only to the Emperor now.
You're not my master.
I would not presume to control you. Let me explain.
It is true that I'm here to lead our important war effort--but there are other reasons I chose Corellia....
Significant pillars of Baras's power base are here. And together, we can tear them down!
You clearly have great power, but the Emperor needs you alive.
We cannot risk exposing you.
I'm interested in any chance to hurt Baras.
I like the sound of that.
But he will make more attempts on your life. You must relocate to my ship where my crew can protect you.
No offense, but you'll only slow me down.
I work alone.
It won't take Baras long to dispatch more assassins. You will relocate to my ship where my crew can protect you.
Far be it for me to defy you. My protection here has taken a recent hit. But before I go, let me guide you....
Most of the Dark Council knows Baras is not the Emperor's true Voice, but Baras's two top agents force them to support his bid.
One agent safeguards secrets that he uses as leverage. The other leads Jedi Masters in campaigns against Sith who defy him. Now, if they were to disappear....
My old master will be left high and dry.
Baras's leverage disappears.
Exactly. His support on the council will evaporate.
Tell me where to find them.
I can do that.
I am still searching for Baras's false Jedi, but expect results soon. I have the other agent in my sights.
I want to go bang down Baras's door.
I tire of indirect strikes.
Attack him now, and the entire Dark Council will defend him. Follow my lead, and you'll have your day.
Colonel Senks of the Corellian resistance is Baras's plant. His stronghold is a labyrinth of secret passages.
Baras's first undercover agent is posing as Colonel Senks of the Corellian resistance. His stronghold is a labyrinth of secret passages.
Unless you scramble his security codes before laying siege, he'll be able to flee through a dozen different escape tunnels.
No one escapes me.
It won't matter.
We only have one chance at this. Better to corner the man, and leave nothing to chance.
Only a coward plans to flee.
So, he's gutless.
Colonel Senks is a survivor. He's smart, and I respect his work for the Empire.
What about Baras's other agent?
And the other target?
My operative is uncovering the identity and location of his Jedi infiltrator. I expect results soon. For now, Senks.
How do I scramble the security codes?
What's the answer?
These pulse disruptors will kill all electronic code emissions--effectively locking Senks's secret passages.
In truth, he's a fantastic resource--it will be a shame to lose an agent of his caliber.
There is no mercy for the servants of Baras.
He must die.
Perhaps you will find another solution when you're there.
I'll compel him to denounce Baras and join you.
Maybe he can be reasoned with.
An excellent solution, if it can be done.
Don't get ahead of yourself, Vowrawn. Let's catch up to him first.
One thing at a time.
It's always wise to see the next step when dealing with Darth Baras.
My remaining apprentices and I will report to your ship now. I expect to have information on Baras's second agent soon. May we both be swift.
My apprentices and I will report to your ship now. The minute I can point you to the second of Baras's agents, I will. For now, Colonel Senks!
My lord, I have Darth Vowrawn here for you...
The Darth and his entourage are settling in here. Has a word for you...
Hey, did somebody order a Darth with a side of Sith Lords? I have Vowrawn here for you...
My friend, I am in the hands of your crew now. They are an interesting assortment.
Try not to get in the way.
Just sit tight.
I'm used to owning the space I occupy. But I will respect your territory.
My people are capable, don't worry.
You're in good hands.
I hope their talents are not required.
They will extend every courtesy to you.
Make yourself at home.
I will enjoy that.
I should have mentioned--in order to reach Colonel Senks' compound you'll have to clear the way to that sector. See Darth Charnus for details.
Oh, and once you've neutralized Senks, if he doesn't hand over Baras's sensitive files, please do destroy the database.
If Senks doesn't hand over the files he safeguards, once you've neutralized him, I advise destroying his database to eliminate it all.
Once done, contact me. But leave the compound first. It's Baras's facility and sure to be bugged. Until then.
